title: CME Group says U.S. stock futures hit down limit, continue to trade
text: Futures contracts on the U.S. stock market had hit their 5% overnight down limit but trading in the instruments continued, the CME Group said on Monday.

title: U.S. stock futures sink by 5% down limit after crude rout
text: U.S. stock futures plunged 5% to hit their daily down limit and halt trading after the biggest single-day loss in oil futures in almost 30 years on Sunday exacerbated fears of a credit crunch across financial markets.

title: Over $21 billion wiped off cryptocurrency market in 24 hours after massive oil price plunge
text: Bitcoin, the biggest cryptocurrency by value, fell 8% in 24 hours with other big digital coins ethereum, XRP and bitcoin cash, posting double-digit losses.

title: US Stocks Set To Open Lower As Futures Tank On Coronavirus Fears, Oil Crash
text: The United States stock market is set to hit another low on Monday as futures contracts plummeted in Sunday's off-hours session.

title: Stock Market: Traders Are Having A Field Day
text: Fear and panic about negative uncertainties provide trading opportunities

title: Up to 2 million bpd of oil demand may be lost due to coronavirus, says expert
text: Vandana Hari of Vanda Insights says she sees very anemic or zero growth in oil markets in 2020.

title: The Margin: Stocks plunge, coronavirus spreads and Trump retweets image of himself playing a fiddle with an ominous message
text: Is President Donald Trump fiddling while the world burns?

title: Shares sunk by coronavirus panic, oil prices plunge
text: Asian shares sank in a sea of red on Monday as panicked investors fled to bonds to hedge the economic shock of the coronavirus, and oil plunged more than 20% after Saudi Arabia slashed its official selling price.

title: Gold jumps past $1,700 level for first time in seven years on virus fears
text: Gold prices jumped past the $1,700 per ounce level for the first time since late 2012 on Monday, as a widening coronavirus outbreak and a plunge in crude oil hammered equities and sent investors scurrying for safe havens.

title: Oil price plunges 20% as Saudis vow to step up production
text: Move follows Russian refusal to join Opec-led production cut aimed at keeping prices high

title: Analyst View: Oil price plunge, coronavirus fears unleash market chaos
text: Financial markets have been thrown into turmoil following Saudi Arabia's response to the collapse of OPEC+ talks and concerns about the global spread of the coronavirus.

title: The Markets Are Plunging...Are You Doing Anything About It?
text: The bond market has been flashing red signals about the health of the global economy for the past two weeks as the fallout from the COVID-19 outbreak continues to unfold.

title: 10-year Treasury yield plunges below 0.5%
text: The benchmark 10-year Treasury yield broke below 0.5% for the first time ever as coronavirus fears, coupled with an all-out oil price war, sent investors flocking to safer government bonds.

title: US stock futures tumble 4% on coronavirus fears in pre-market trade
text: The price of futures contracts for the S&P 500 index, a Wall Street benchmark, fell more than 4% on Sunday as off-hours trading for US equity markets resumed, a sign that investors fear the toll from the fast-spreading coronavirus will deepen. Italy, the country hardest hit by the virus in Europe, essentially locked down much.

title: Oil drops by most since 1991 as Saudi Arabia launches price war
text: Oil prices suffered an historic collapse late Sunday after Saudi Arabia shocked the market by launching a price war against onetime ally Russia.

title: Dow futures down more than 900 points, kicking off another rough week for the markets
text: Stock futures were down again Sunday evening as the novel coronavirus outbreak continues to roil financial markets.

title: Asian shares set to tumble, oil prices crash
text: Asian share markets were set for a beating on Monday as investors fled to bonds to hedge the economic shock of the coronavirus, and oil plunged more than 20% after Saudi Arabia slashed its official selling price.

title: Oil futures fall over 20% after Saudi Arabia slashes selling prices
text: Oil futures dropped more than 20% on Sunday to their lowest since 2016 after Saudi Arabia slashed its official selling price (OSP), signaling the start of a price war after OPEC talks with Russia failed to produce an agreement on production cuts.

title: U.S. stock futures tumble at open on coronavirus contagion fears
text: The price of futures contracts for the S&P 500 index fell more than 4% on Sunday as trading for U.S. equity markets resumed, a sign that investors fear the toll from the fast-spreading coronavirus will deepen.

title: Oil plummets 30% as OPEC deal failure sparks price war fears
text: Oil prices dropped in early trading as the breakdown in OPEC talks stoked oversupply fears.

title: Dow futures drop 800 points as all-out oil price war adds to coronavirus stress
text: Investors continue to brace for the economic fallout from the spreading coronavirus, while a shocking all-out oil price war added to the anxiety.

title: PIMCO sees mild recession due to virus but tight credit poses risk
text: Pacific Investment Management Co (PIMCO), one of the world's largest investment firms, told clients on Sunday the coronavirus outbreak is likely to cause a relatively mild and short recession though tight credit markets could worsen the downturn.

title: Wall Street coronavirus contingency plans - the state of play

title: Fed slashing rates to zero is more likely than a recession, Barclays' top economist says
text: Barclays' Michael Gapen believes the Federal Reserve will take more steps to ease the coronavirus impact.

title: Podcast: Grading Your Stocks To Prepare For A Market Correction
text: Which stocks should you hold and sell in a market correction?

title: Uncertainty Breeds Opportunity
text: The stock market tried to rebound on Friday after a crazy week as the market may be finally getting sold out. The impact of the SARS-CoV-2 virus on the economy is not clear but uncertainty can create opportunities for those who look the charts.

title: Oil now a 'bigger problem for markets than the coronavirus,' analyst says
text: As oil prices plummet deeper into bear market territory, the repercussions could be felt throughout the U.S. economy.

title: Investor fears rise over recession, bear market as coronavirus spreads in U.S.
text: The words "bear market" and "recession" are being used with increasing frequency as investors try to assess how badly the coronavirus outbreak will damage global growth and to what extent it could further weigh on asset prices.

title: VIX Flashes A Bullish Signal In A Volatile Market
text: The VIX is often referred to as the markets fear gauge. Last week it flashed a bullish signal according to research.

title: Plummeting oil prices and mortgage rates could boost consumers despite coronavirus fears
text: Analysts argue that a continued decline in oil prices and mortgage rates amid the coronavirus outbreak will give the consumer a boost that could help delay a possible recession.

title: Oil Likely To Slump Below $30 Courtesy Failure Of OPEC+ And Saudi Indignation
text: Dramatic collapse of OPEC+ and the end of Saudi-Russian diplomatic camaraderie makes a bad situation worse for oil markets already weighed down by the coronavirus.
